snippet: The government asked Parliament to authorize incursions into Syria and Iraq and the foreign use of Turkish bases in the fight against the Islamic State.
abstract: Turkish government seeks mandate from Parliament to expand its cross-border military operations into Iraq and Syria; move signals that country will play a more active role in the United States-led international military campaign to combat Islamic State militants.
lead_paragraph: The government asked Parliament to authorize incursions into Syria and Iraq and the foreign use of Turkish bases in the fight against the Islamic State.

headline.main: Turkey Makes Bid to Expand Military Role
headline.print_headline: Turkey Makes Bid to Expand Military Role

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
